ygData.messageBody:
Hi!

> Actually, there is one important thing that is handled completely on the
> client side. That is, where you are in the world. (Proof, sit in a spot,
> unplug your ethernet cable from the back of your PC, run 1000 spaces,
> plug it back in, see that you're still there and not at the other place.)
> So it should be possible to modify the X/Y/Z location in the client and
> have that information passed on to the server...

I also believe what targeting happens only on client side. If client is
notified about monster (update has been sent from server what such
monster exists) you can target it without server check. Afaik targeting
in EQ uses bounding boxes tracing, and im sure it is made by client, not
server. So, because you can shoot your DDs through walls and monsters in
most cases cannot move through walls, it can be ultimate cheating.
Target any monster in dungeon on client, and nuke him from behind a wall
without any opposition. Of course, server do not send ALL monsters in
zone to client, so you dont know their IDs and cannot target them at
all, but you possible can target any mob in ~30 meters radius.
